data
Class NormalDistribution

java.lang.Object
  data.NormalDistribution

public class NormalDistribution
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements multivariate normal distributions having an arbitrary number of dimensions. It also includes several, different methods for calculating the distance between two normal distributions.

Constructor Summary
NormalDistribution(double[][] values)
          Models a list of values as a normal distribution.
NormalDistribution(int[][] values)
          Models a list of values as a normal distribution.
 
Method Summary
 double definiteIntegral(double a, double b, int d)
          Returns the definite integral of this normal distribution for the range [a, b].
 float KLDivergence(NormalDistribution other)
          Calculates the Kullback-Leibler divergence from this normal distribution to another one.
 float overlapLevel(NormalDistribution other)
          Calculates the level of overlap between this normal distribution and another one.

Method Detail

KLDivergence

public float KLDivergence(NormalDistribution other)
Calculates the Kullback-Leibler divergence from this normal distribution to another one. Inspired from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multivariate_normal_distribution

Parameters:
other - The normal distribution to compare this distribution with.
Returns:
The KL-divergence from this normal distribution to another one.

overlapLevel

public float overlapLevel(NormalDistribution other)
Calculates the level of overlap between this normal distribution and another one.

Parameters:
other - Another normal distribution.
Returns:
A value in the range [0, 1] indicating the level of overlap between both distributions.

definiteIntegral

public double definiteIntegral(double a,
                               double b,
                               int d)
Returns the definite integral of this normal distribution for the range [a, b].

Parameters:
a - Starting point.
b - Ending point.
d - Index of the dimension.
Returns:
The definite integral of this normal distribution for the range [a, b].
